title: Walmart Posts Stronger Sales in Holiday Quarter
sub_head: Retailer says it expects some relief from rising supply-chain costs and Covid-19 expenses this year
body:
Walmart Inc. reported rising sales over the winter holiday shopping season as the countryâ€™s largest retailer navigates rising costs, but consumers continue to spend even as inflation sends prices for a range of products higher.
Comparable U.S. sales, those from stores and digital channels operating for at least 12 months excluding fuel sales, rose 5.6% in the quarter ended Jan. 28, compared with the same period a year earlier.
